snippet: Lindsey Vonn, whose ski racing career has mixed stirring triumph with frightening spills, tore two knee ligaments and was airlifted from the Alpine world championships.
abstract: American skier Lindsey Vonn tears two knee ligaments in crash at Alpine world championships in Austria; will undergo reconstructive surgery and is expected to return to racing for 2013-2014 World Cup season.

byline.original: By KELLEY McMILLAN and BILL PENNINGTON
byline.contributor: Bill Pennington contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Lindsey Vonn, whose ski racing career has mixed stirring triumph with frightening spills, tore two knee ligaments and was airlifted from the Alpine world championships.

headline.seo: Lindsey Vonn Hospitalized After Crash in Super-G
headline.main: Crash Injuries End Vonn’s Season, but Not Her Hopes
headline.print_headline: Crash Injuries End Vonn’s Season, But Not Her Hopes
